meanings.definition: A person who delivers a heavy blow or strike.
meanings.sent1: The boxer was known as one of the strongest wallopers in the ring.
meanings.sent2: The wallopers in the action movie packed a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The wallopers at the carnival game were tough to beat!
meanings.sent4: Her words hit me like wallopers, leaving me stunned.
meanings.sent5: The wallopers of the storm shook the entire house.

meanings.sent1: The wallopers arrived at the scene to control the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The city wallopers patrolled the streets to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids ran away from the wallopers playing a prank.
meanings.sent4: The wallopers in blue uniforms maintained law and order.
meanings.sent5: The wallopers directed traffic during the busy event.

meanings.definition: A powerful or forceful hit or strike.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm brought down wallopers of rain on the roof.
meanings.sent2: The wallopers of the hammer echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The wallopers of the drumbeat energized the crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent4: The wallopers of the waves crashed against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The wallopers of the earthquake shook the entire town.
